Posts.Content: jam1111 wrote: I am 43, awaiting an appointment with a surgeon for a biopsy of an abnormal mammogram.  I have no family history.  I am scared to death.  I work at home, but all I can do lately is log on to this site and read through the conversations looking for some reassurance.  Believe me, it is helping, but I am so upset over the words "irregular margins/borders."  Doesn't this almost always turn out to be a cancer of some type?  If my mass had smooth borders, wouldn't it be more likely a fibroma or cyst?  Help!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: "irregular margins" freaking me out jam1111 Beesie

Posts.Content: jam1111 wrote: I had an abnormal mammogram that showed "irregular margins," and am awaiting an appointment with a surgeon for biopsy.  I am very frightened about all this.  No family history and only 43.  Can someone tell me, don't irregular margins usually mean some type of cancer as opposed to smooth borders, i.e. fibroma or cyst?  I really need some reassurance as I got none from my doctor.  My surgery appointment isn't for another week.  I am so terrified, but trying to remain strong. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: very worried - "irregular margins" jam1111 Debberly
